paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the KCNH2 G1681A variant, including penetrance data for affected and unaffected carriers.

patients.demographics: Patient: 15 years, female; Mother: 55 years, female
patients.phenotype: Patient presented with 11 episodes of syncope and prolonged QTc interval; Mother is asymptomatic with prolonged QTc.

individual_records.phenotype_details: 11 episodes of syncope, QTc interval up to 571 ms.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The female LQT2 patient in this study presented at age of 15 years with 11 episodes of syncope in 12 months with seizure on occasions.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Asymptomatic carrier with prolonged QTc of up to 514 ms.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The patient's mother (55 years) is an asymptomatic carrier of the same mutation and is not currently under treatment but does have a prolonged QTc of up to 514 ms.

functional_data.summary: The KCNH2 G1681A mutation leads to prolonged action potential duration in cardiomyocytes derived from patient-specific hiPSCs.

variants.segregation_data: The mutation segregates with disease in the family; the patient is affected while the mother is an unaffected carrier.
variants.evidence_level: strong evidence based on clinical presentation and functional assays.
variants.additional_notes: The mutation is located in the pore-forming region of the Ikr channel.
key_quotes: The mutation causes an alanine to threonine substitution at position 561 of the encoded protein (p.Ala561Thr).
With a QTc >500 ms, a documented LQT2 gene mutation, and an adverse clinical history, the patient was felt to be at significant risk of a future arrhythmic event.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
